setBinning.name: setBinning
setBinning.description: Overrides the binning rules followed by the chart with the binning rules provided to this API. If some time unit is missing from the input binning rules, then the default multipliers for that time unit will be used by the chart. If any incorrect multipliers are provided to a unit, they will be ignored.

0.code: // Iterate on all charts rendered on a page and move them to a common locationvar sidebar = document.getElementById('sidebar-html-div'), // assuming that your common container is this    chart;for (chart in FusionCharts.items) {    sidebar.appendChild(FusionCharts.getObjectReference(chart).parentNode);}// The above can be done without using this deprecated getObjectReference method.for (chart in FusionCharts.items) {    chart = FusionCharts.items[chart];    chart.ref && sidebar.appendChild(chart.ref.parentNode);}

millisecond.name: millisecond
millisecond.description: All the multipliers applicable for the millisecond unit.

second.name: second
second.description: All the multipliers applicable for the second unit.

minute.name: minute
minute.description: All the multipliers applicable for the minute unit

hour.name: hour
hour.description: All the multipliers applicable for the hour unit.

day.name: day
day.description: All the multipliers applicable for the day unit.

month.name: month
month.description: All the multipliers applicable for the month unit.

year.name: year
year.description: All the multipliers applicable for the year unit.

getBinning.name: getBinning
getBinning.description: Returns the binning rules that are being followed by the chart. If any custom binning rules are in effect, the returned rules will take into account the modifications made by them as well.

setCurrentBin.name: setCurrentBin
setCurrentBin.description:
Sets the provided unit and multiplier as the current binning in the chart by adjusting spread of time on the focus canvases. The provided multiplier must be a valid multiplier for the given time unit (as per the currently active binning rules in the chart). If it is not, then there is no visible effect of calling this method. If the multiplier is not provided, it is assumed to be 1. If the unit is not provided, there should be no visible effect of calling this method. 

 1.Must be a valid standard bins? 

 2.Restrict right, if left can not be extended further update right. 

 3.Best visual is achieved by 1 month binning, user provided 2months, shall that change the viz?

unit.name: unit
unit.description: The unit of time to be represented in each bin - `millisecond`, `second`, `minute`, `hour`, `day`, `month` or `year`.

multiplier.name: multiplier
multiplier.description: The multiplier for the `unit` to be represented in each bin.

getCurrentBin.name: getCurrentBin
getCurrentBin.description: Provides information about the binning applied in the chart when the method was invoked.

unit.name: unit
unit.description: The unit of time to be represented in each bin - `millisecond`, `second`, `minute`, `hour`, `day`, `month` or `year`.

multiplier.name: multiplier
multiplier.description: The multiplier for the `unit` to be represented in each bin.

setTimeSelection.name: setTimeSelection
setTimeSelection.description: Updates the start and end time of the time selection on the focus canvases. This will also result in a change across all of the chartâ€™s components accordingly.

0.code: // Iterate on all charts rendered on a page and move them to a common locationvar sidebar = document.getElementById('sidebar-html-div'), // assuming that your common container is this    chart;for (chart in FusionCharts.items) {    sidebar.appendChild(FusionCharts.getObjectReference(chart).parentNode);}// The above can be done without using this deprecated getObjectReference method.for (chart in FusionCharts.items) {    chart = FusionCharts.items[chart];    chart.ref && sidebar.appendChild(chart.ref.parentNode);}

start.name: start
start.description: The UNIX timestamp corresponding to the time at which to start the time selection visible on the focus canvases.

end.name: end
end.description: The UNIX timestamp corresponding to the time at which to end the time selection visible on the focus canvases.

getTimeSelection.name: getTimeSelection
getTimeSelection.description: Provides start and end UNIX timestamps of the visible window of the time axis.

start.name: start
start.description: The UNIX timestamp corresponding to the time at which to start the time selection visible on the focus canvases.

end.name: end
end.description: The UNIX timestamp corresponding to the time at which to end the time selection visible on the focus canvases.

resizeTo.name: resizeTo
resizeTo.description:
Resizes the chart to the specified width and height. The values for the width and height are passed, in pixels or percentage, as parameters to this function. If the function is called without any parameters, it __returns__ the current value of the chart width and height. 

 This function is useful in controlling the chart dimensions based on changes in the dimensions of a resizable dialog box. It is also useful in resizing charts for responsive layouts, based on device orientation change. 

 

 >When the chart dimensions are set in percentage, the chart partially redraws itself when the chart container is resized. The chart uses a very low-profile polling, at an interval of __300 ms__ to check whether the container has effectively resized.

width.name: width
width.description: Chart width to set, in pixels or percentage

height.name: height
height.description: Chart height to set, in pixels or percentage

lockResize.name: lockResize
lockResize.description: Allows users to controls whether the chart will be dynamically resizable or not when rendered using percent height and width.

state.name: state
state.description: Setting this parameter to __true__ will lock the automatic percentage-based resizing. If resize is already locked, sending `false` unlocks it.

getSVGString.name: getSVGString
getSVGString.description: Returns the SVG string of a chart. This function can be called only after the chart has rendered.

callBackFN( svgString ).name: callBackFN( svgString )
callBackFN( svgString ).description: callBackFN is called only when `getSVGString()` completes its execution.

keepImages.name: keepImages
keepImages.description: To get the images present in the chart from the SVG string, set the parameter of `keepImages` object to `1`.

static-batchExport.name: batchExport
static-batchExport.description: Exports multiple charts in a single image. This method either takes __no arguments__ or takes __an object as an argument__.

imageWidth.name: imageWidth
imageWidth.description: Width of the exported image (of the charts)

imageHeight.name: imageHeight
imageHeight.description: Height of the exported image (of the charts)
imageHeight.defaultvalue: (Total height of all charts + 5) * (number of charts + 1)

charts.name: charts
charts.description: The configuration required for the chart(s) being exported can be provided in this object using the attributes given below:

id.name: id
id.description: Valid FusionCharts ID, to attach the chart on the main image

x.name: x
x.description: x-coordinate for positioning the exported image

y.name: y
y.description: y-coordinate for positioning the exported image

width.name: width
width.description:
Custom width for the exported image 

 __Note__: If only one value from the width and the height of the chart is provided, the value of the other is calculated in a way that the aspect ratio is maintained.

heigt.name: height
heigt.description:
Custom height for the exported image 

 __Note__: If only one value from the width and the height of the chart is provided, the value of the other is calculated in a way that the aspect ratio is maintained.

background.name: background
background.description: The configuration required for the exported image's background can be provided in this object using the attributes given below:

bgColor.name: bgColor
bgColor.description: Background color for the exported image

bgImage.name: bgImage
bgImage.description: Background image for the exported images

bgImageX.name: bgImageX
bgImageX.description: Starting x-coordinate for positioning the background image

bgImageY.name: bgImageY
bgImageY.description: Starting y-coordinate for positioning the background image

bgImageWidth.name: bgImageWidth
bgImageWidth.description:
Width of the background image 

 __Note__: If only one value from the width and the height is provided, the value of the other is calculated in a way that the aspect ratio is maintained.

bgImageHeight.name: bgImageHeight
bgImageHeight.description:
Height of the background image 

 __Note__: If only one value from the width and the height is provided, the value of the other is calculated in a way that the aspect ratio is maintained.

exportTargetWindow.name: exportTargetWindow
exportTargetWindow.description:
Set to `_self` to open the exported image in the same window 

 Set to `_blank` to open the exported image in a new window

exportAction.name: exportAction
exportAction.description:
Set to `_save` to save the exported image on the server 

 Set to `_download` to send back the image to the client as a download

exportFileName.name: exportFileName
exportFileName.description: Default file name (excluding the extension) for the exported image

exportHandler.name: exportHandler
exportHandler.description:
__For server-side exporting__: Path of the export handler (the ready-to-use scripts provided by FusionCharts) 

 __For client-side exporting__: DOM ID of the FusionCharts Export Component embedded in the web page, along with the chart

exportFormats.name: exportFormats
exportFormats.description:
List of formats in which the chart can be exported 

 The formats are separated using the *|* (pipe) character.

exportCallback.name: exportCallback
exportCallback.description: Name of the JavaScript function that is called when the export process finishes

exportAtClientSide.name: exportAtClientSide
exportAtClientSide.description: Set to `1` to enable client-side exporting

getChartData.name: getChartData
getChartData.description: Return the data using with the chart has been rendered.

format.name: format
format.description: Format in which chart data has to be retrieved

setChartData.name: setChartData
setChartData.description:
Sets the data for a chart. 

When this function is called on a chart that is already rendered, the chart is instantly updated with the new data. When it is used to set data for a chart before it has rendered, data is initially stored internally and is passed to the chart when it is rendered. 

 

 >A preferrable alternative to using the `setChartData()` method is to pass chart data to the `dataSource` attribute of the FusionCharts constructor.

data.name: data
data.description: Data to be passed to the chart

format.name: format
format.description:
Format of the data being passed. If the value for this parameter is not a valid [dataFormat](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-properties#dataFormats), then the default or previously set data format is assumed. 

 >If the data format is already known, then the [setJSONData()](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-methods#setJSONData) or the [setXMLData()](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-methods#setXMLData) methods can be used.

getChartAttribute.name: getChartAttribute
getChartAttribute.description: Fetches value of chart attributes explicitly applied to the root `chart` object (or the `<chart>` node element).

attribute.name: attribute
attribute.description: To fetch the value of a single attribute, pass the attribute name as a string. For multiple attributes, pass an array of attribute names. Values will be returned in the order of the attribute names in the array.

setChartAttribute.name: setChartAttribute
setChartAttribute.description: Updates a chart's attributes with a new attribute-value pair, thus updating the chart's data definition root (the `<chart>` node in the XML data or the `chart` object in the JSON data).

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.description: To set/update multiple attributes at once, an object containing all the key-value pairs is passed. In case of a single value, a string that is the key (the attribute name) is passed.

value.name: value
value.description: If the `attributes` parameter is a single string value, the `value` parameter contains the value for that key.

addEventListener.name: addEventListener
addEventListener.description: Used to attach an event to the chart.

type.name: type
type.description: Type (name) of the event to listen to. To register the listener for multiple events in the same registration call, provide all event names as an array.

listener.name: listener
listener.description:
Function to be exceuted when the event is triggered. If multiple listeners are bound to an event, the listeners are executed in the order of definition, with arguments specific to the triggered event. 

 >Click [here](http://www.fusioncharts.com/dev/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-typedefs.html#eventListener) to read more about the eventListener arguments.

removeEventListener.name: removeEventListener
removeEventListener.description: Used to remove an event attached to the chart.

type.name: type
type.description: Type (name) of the event whose listener(s) has to be removed

static-getObjectReference.name: getObjectReference
static-getObjectReference.description: Return the DOM element created by FusionCharts in which charts will be rendered `<span>`

0.code: // Iterate on all charts rendered on a page and move them to a common locationvar sidebar = document.getElementById('sidebar-html-div'), // assuming that your common container is this    chart;for (chart in FusionCharts.items) {    sidebar.appendChild(FusionCharts.getObjectReference(chart).parentNode);}// The above can be done without using this deprecated getObjectReference method.for (chart in FusionCharts.items) {    chart = FusionCharts.items[chart];    chart.ref && sidebar.appendChild(chart.ref.parentNode);}

id.name: id
id.description: ID of the chart, whose `DOMElement` is to be referenced.

clone.name: clone
clone.description: Creates a copy of a chart instance, creating a new chart with identical construction properties of the chart being cloned. The cloned chart, assigned an auto-generated ID, is rendered in a container DOM element that is explicitly provided.

overrides.name: overrides
overrides.description: Object containing instructions for changes in the cloned chart. For example, passing `pieChart.clone({type: 'column2d'});` will clone the pie chart, but set its chart-type as `column2d`. It accepts all the construction parameters of a new [FusionCharts](/api/fusioncharts) instance.

argsOnly.name: argsOnly
argsOnly.description: Set to __true__, if a new FusionCharts object is not required. In that case, it causes the function to return a serializable object that can later be passed to create a new FusionCharts instance, and therefore, create a clone.

static-ready.name: ready
static-ready.description: Accepts a function as an argument and that is executed by FusionCharts when the page is ready (library loaded, DOM elements rendered).

0.code: // Render a chart within a chart container `div` element.FusionCharts.ready(function (FusionCharts) {    var chart = new FusionCharts({        type: "column2d",        renderAt: "chart-container-div",        dataSource: "my-chart-data.json",        dataFormat: "jsonurl"    });    // Since we are in the `ready` block, the `chart-container-div`    // element should be available by now.    chart.render();});

readyCallback.name: readyCallback
readyCallback.description: Callback function executed when the FusionCharts framework is ready

args.name: args
args.description: Argument to be passed to the callback function

context.name: context
context.description: To execute a function, passed using the `fn` parameter, in a different scope than the default [FusionCharts](/api/fusioncharts) scope, pass the appropriate class object here.

dataReady.name: dataReady
dataReady.description: Determines whether a chart will render properly with the data set and returns true or false.

available.name: available
available.description: Setting this parameter to __true__ returns the status of the data, irrespective of its compatibility with the chart type. In that case, this function will return __false__ if data provided to the chart triggers the [dataLoadError](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-dataLoadError) or [dataInvalid](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-dataInvalid) events

hasRendered.name: hasRendered
hasRendered.description: Returns true if the chart has rendered successfully, false if it has not.

print.name: print
print.description: Prints individual charts. It hides all elements on a page except the chart to print and then invokes the page printing function (`window.print()`).

options.name: options
options.description: Object containing the printing options configured

hideButtons.name: hideButtons
hideButtons.description: Hides all buttons on the chart

exportChart.name: exportChart
exportChart.description: Exports a chart as an image or as a PDF document.

options.name: options
options.description: The `exportChart` method takes the following parameters:

exportFormat.name: exportFormat
exportFormat.description:
A chart can be exported in one of the following formats:  

 | Export Format | Description | 

 | --------- | :-------------| 

 | `png`| Exports the charts in the high quality lossless PNG format | 

 | `jpg` | Exports the chart in the high quality JPEG image format       | 

 | `pdf` | Exports the chart as a PDF document |

exportFileName.name: exportFileName
exportFileName.description: File name for the chart being exported, excluding the extension. The extension is automatically appended depending on the value of `exportFormat` parameter.

exportTargetWindow.name: exportTargetWindow
exportTargetWindow.description: When the `exportAction` parameter is set to `download` as , this parameter lets you configure whether the return image or PDF will open in the same window (as an attachment for download), or in a new browser window (`_blank`).

exportAction.name: exportAction
exportAction.description:
Specifies whether the exported image will be sent back to the browser as download, or whether it will be saved on to the server.  

 | Action Value | Description | 

 | ----------| :------------------------| 

 | `download` | The exported chart image or PDF will be downloaded as file. | 

 | `save` | The exported chart will be saved on the server.| 

 

 >For the charts to be saved on the server, you would need to setup your own export handling server.

exportCallback.name: exportCallback
exportCallback.description: Callback JavaScript function executed when the export process is complete. If this parameter is not assigned a value, then the `window.FC_Exported` is executed.

showChartMessage.name: showChartMessage
showChartMessage.description: Shows a text message on a chart.

modal.name: modal
modal.description: Boolean value to indicate whether the message will be shown on an overlay button or on the chart.

cancelable.name: cancelable
cancelable.description:
If set to __true__, the modal can be closed by clicking. Defaults to __false__. 

 >Applicable only if `modal` is set to __true__.

render.name: render
render.description: Renders a chart inside a container element on a page. If the chart is already rendered, it can be re-rendered inside the same container DOM element or a different element.

containerElement.name: containerElement
containerElement.description: Reference or ID of the DOM element inside which the chart is to be rendered. If this argument is not provided, it is assumed that the `renderAt` attribute is provided during chart creation.

insertMode.name: insertMode
insertMode.description: Method for inserting the chart's DOM element within the `containerElement`. Click [here](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-properties#DOMInsertModes) to read more about  the DOM insert modes.

callback.name: callback
callback.description: Callback function executed after the chart is successfully rendered. If the last parameter to the `render()` function is a function, it is treated as a callback.

dispose.name: Dispose
dispose.description: Disposes a chart completely, when called on an instance of FusionCharts. This clears the entire chart object and removes it from the DOM tree structure. When the chart is successfully disposed, `chartInstance.disposed` is set to __true__.

configure.name: configure
configure.description: Configures status messages that are displayed while rendering a chart. For example, while a chartâ€™s data is being fetched from a remote URL, the chart will display the message __Retrieving data. Please wait.__

option.name: option
option.description: To configure a single attribute, specify the attribute (the key) as a string. To configure multiple attributes, this can be an object having key-value pairs of all configuration options.

value.name: value
value.description: If the `option` parameter has a single value as the key, this parameter is the value of that key.
